'''Peter McMullen''' (born 11 May 1942)<ref>[http://www.dmg.tuwien.ac.at/gruber/gruber_arbeiten/mcmullen.pdf Peter McMullen], [[Peter M. Gruber]], retrieved 2013-11-03.</ref> is a British mathematician, a professor emeritus of mathematics at [[University College London]].<ref>[https://iris.ucl.ac.uk/iris/browse/profile?upi=PMCMU56 UCL IRIS information system], accessed 2013-11-03.</ref>

==Education and career==
McMullen earned bachelors and master's degrees from [[Trinity College, Cambridge]], and taught at [[Western Washington University]] from 1968 to 1969.<ref>[http://beta.worldcat.org/archivegrid/data/55804571 Peter McMullen Collection, 1967-1968], Special Collections, Wilson Library, Western Washington University, retrieved from worldcat.org 2013-11-03.</ref>

==Contributions==
He is known for his work in [[polyhedral combinatorics]] and [[discrete geometry]], and in particular for proving what was then called the upper bound conjecture and now is the [[upper bound theorem]]. This result states that [[cyclic polytope]]s have the maximum possible number of faces among all polytopes with a given dimension and number of vertices.<ref>{{citation|title=Lectures on Polytopes|volume=152|series=Graduate Texts in Mathematics|first=Günter M.|last=Ziegler|authorlink=Günter M. Ziegler|publisher=Springer|year=1995|isbn=9780387943657|page=254|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=xd25TXSSUcgC&pg=PA254|quotation=Finally, in 1970 McMullen gave a complete proof of the upper-bound conjecture – since then it has been known as the upper bound theorem. McMullen's proof is amazingly simple and elegant, combining to key tools: shellability and ''h''-vectors.}}</ref> McMullen also formulated the g-conjecture, later the [[g-theorem]] of Billera, Lee, and Stanley, characterizing the [[f-vector|''f''-vectors]] of [[simplicial sphere]]s.<ref>{{citation

 | volume = 336
 | year = 2007|quotation=The problem of characterizing the ''f''-vectors of onvex polytopes is ... far from a solution, but there are important contributions towards it. For simplicial convex polytopes a characterization was proposed by McMullen in the form of his celebrated ''g''-conjecture. The ''g''-conjecture was proved by Billera and Lee and Stanley}}.</ref>

==Awards and honours==
McMullen was invited to speak at the 1974 [[International Congress of Mathematicians]]; his contribution there had the title ''Metrical and combinatorial properties of convex polytopes''.<ref>[http://www.mathunion.org/ICM/ICM1974.1/Main/icm1974.1.0491.0496.ocr.pdf ICM 1974 proceedings].</ref>

He was elected as a foreign member of the [[Austrian Academy of Sciences]] in 2006.<ref>[http://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/people/june_2006 Awards, Appointments, Elections & Honours], University College London, June 2006, retrieved 2013-11-03.</ref>

In 2012 he became an inaugural [[fellow]] of the [[American Mathematical Society]].<ref>[http://www.ams.org/profession/fellows-list List of AMS fellows], retrieved 2013-11-03.</ref>
